page.text: MB1649 415 South Street, Waltham, MA 02453
hanjun@brandeis.edu
EDUCATION
Brandeis University, Waltham, MA
B.A. in Business, Mathematics and Economics December 2015
Overall GPA 3.8, Dean’s list
Relevant Courses: Mathematics Probability, Mathematics Statistics, Differential Equation, Econometrics,
Corporate Finance, Intermediate Financial Accounting, Introduction to Real Analysis, Complex Analysis,
Global Economy, Marketing Management, Financial Economics, Macroeconomics
Tianjin University of Finance and Economics, Tianjin, China Sep 2011- Dec 2012
Top 1%, overall GPA 3.9
EXPERIENCE
AIG, Inc, Boston, MA
Jun 2015- Aug 2015
Utilized financial and environmental modeling to conduct risk analysis and develop technical premium
Researched valuation and re-evaluated commercial properties’ assets to improve financial analysis’s accuracy
Participated in quoting and binding process with senior underwriters and provided technical and model support
Attended 7 major broker meeting events and facilitated communication between underwriters and brokers
Audited existing accounts and addressed issues in binders, policies and endorsements
Heron Interverse, LLC, Boston, MA Jun 2014- Aug 2014
Conducted marketing research and analyzed market trends, competition, and potential strategic partners using
information obtained from multiple data sources and social media platforms for local business clients
Performed in-depth financial and operational due diligence on clients’ business and presented comprehensive
strategic plans in client-facing meetings and pitch events, created 4 major business opportunities
Maintained social media platforms and publicized clients information on mainstream media, increased clients’
brand awareness by more than 30 percent
Midtown Property, Inc, Boston, MA Jun 2013- Aug 2013
Set up a system to maintain more than 200 customers’ database for further research and marketing
Prepared financial statements regarding over 20 buildings and performed financial valuation analysis through the
use of discounted cash flow and potential risk evaluation
Helped company hold 7 seminars discussing investment and management of real estate properties in Boston
Assisted with 4 residential and commercial properties’ selling and 13 properties’ leasing process
Bank of China, Shanxi, China Jul 2012- Aug 2012
Arranged client meetings, discussed their financial requirements, and provided appropriate financial advice
Designed, assembled and updated presentation materials and performance reviews for clients portfolios’ analysis
Assisted with deposits, remittance, loans and other financial transactions
SKILLS
Language: Fluent in Mandarin
Technology: Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Bloomberg, STATA, Java, R, Mathematica, Prezi, Photoshop
ACTIVITIES
Chinese Tutor at Brandeis University
Vice president of Tianjin University of Finance and Economics Chorus
NewtonSERVES Volunteer
